text: I'm originally from Taiwan I'm from
Arlington Virginia I'm an Egyptian and
this was actually the first time for me
to live outside my home country the
specific opportunities that I look for
in the beginning of my internship search
one it has to be intellectually
challenging to mentorship I look for
people that I am willing to look up to
and people that I respect and the third
thing that I also look for is the
opportunity for growth when I thought
about what sort of Industry I wanted to
being I kind of had had this growing
interest in the healthcare space to
marry my interest in the public sector
and in a social Mission with business
opportunities for the summer I wanted
something through which I can leverage
my clast experience both as an engineer
and as a product manager and I found
this at sess the career Hub here at hbis
when I first started my internship
search I really started learning about
the institutions what your team looks
like what you do daytoday the Whitney
Museum was very upfront and very
responsive when I spoke to the director
of the museum he was so passionate but
also so open-minded to finding a
solution together that approves that
opportunity alone is worthwhile for me
to commit my one and only summer at HBS
CVS really stood out to me for a number
of different reasons they seem very
invested in the company and its Mission
they talked with a lot of passion they
were really excited about the kind of
work they were doing they did a really
good job showing us the potential for
impact and how mbas can really shape the
way the company is moving most of the
MBA students come to HBS really looking
for a transition I think it's very
important for employers is to know that
when you're talk to an MBA student does
make a difference when the MBA student
feel that you care and really achieving
those goals
